resources.string: There was a problem trying to make a donation, your device may not support in app billing or there may be a problem communicating with the server. Please try again later
No app has created a notification yet. Check back later.

Spark Notifications is currently under development by Sorin Drăghici.
 
 This is an open-source project that can be found at https://github.com/notSorin/spark-notifications .
 
 Spark Notifications uses icons from flaticon.com. Icons used were designed by Freepik https://www.flaticon.com/authors/freepik .
 
 *** v. 1.0.0 (add date) ***
 -Initial app release.
For bug reports, ideas, or if you want to say \"hello\" (with an ironic tone), send an email to contact.lesorin@gmail.com.
When the service is enabled, the screen will turn on when notifications are received.
You will now be taken to your device\'s Notification Access screen.\n \n If you wish to stop Spark Notifications, disable its notifications access.

You will now be taken to your device's Notification Access screen.
 
 For this app to work, it is required to enable its access to notifications in order to wake the screen when notifications are received.
 
 Spark Notifications never reads the content of your notifications. This is an open-source app, which means that anyone can see exactly what the app does by looking at its source code, available at github.com/notSorin/spark-notifications .
When enabled, all apps will turn the screen on when a notification is received.
Select which apps can turn the screen on when notifications are received.
Displays a list with the last 50 apps that have turned the screen on. Older activity is automatically deleted.
Enable this option to allow for custom screen timeouts.
The screen will turn off %d seconds after it is turned on by a notification.\n\nIf the device is unlocked, the screen will not turn off.
The Device Administrator option must be enabled to allow for custom screen timeouts.
The Notifications Service must be enabled to allow for custom screen timeouts.
The Notifications Service and the Device Administrator option must be enabled to allow for custom screen timeouts.
The screen will turn on %d seconds after a notification is received.
The screen will turn on %d second after a notification is received.
The screen will turn on as soon as a notification is received.
When enabled, the screen will always turn on at full brightness.
When enabled, the screen will not turn on when an object is close to the device\'s screen, or when the device is in your pocket.\n\nThis option is not supported by all devices.
When enabled, the screen will turn on when the device is picked up.\n\nThis option is not supported by all devices.
When enabled, the notifications drawer will open when the screen is turned on for notifications.
When enabled, the screen will not turn on between the hours below.
Your support helps the app\'s development.
An error occurred and this action could not be completed. Please try again later.
Your purchase has been cancelled and you have not been charged.
Your latest donation has been completed. Your support is greatly appreciated, and it helps maintain and improve Spark Notifications.\n\nThank you!
Your rate and review helps improve the app.
Enable or disable the dark side of the force.
Don\'t let Obi-Wan find out about this…
